On 6/28/06, Eric Silber <esilber@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks for the res=
ponses to my question.
>
> Apparently the original specs for Java annotatio=
ns mandated inheritance of
> annotations, but
> some implementation issues =
caused that to be scrapped ( ??? ).   Probably
> some performance issue?


=
No, we had to scrap it because inheritance of annotations brought up a
numb=
er of ambiguous scenarios that would have been difficult to explain in a
sp=
ec (I was on the JSR 175 Experts Group).

If  TestNG supports annotation in=
heritance, has it implemented a feature
> which the Java folks specifically=

> kept out of javac ?


Yes, I just implemented it the way I thought made =
sense.  The only thorny
point is:  what about interfaces?  Right now, I dec=
ided to exclude them from
the inheritance search, and so far it hasn't been=
 an issue, but I can always
revisit this if somebody makes a case (a strong=
 case :-)) for it.
